get.description:
Hotspot 2.0 is a WFA specification based upon the 802.11u protocol that provides wireless clients
with a streamlined mechanism to discover and authenticate to suitable networks, and allows
mobile users the ability to roam between partner networks without additional authentication.
Mobility Conductor supports Hotspot 2.0 with enhanced network discovery and selection. Clients
can receive general information about the network identity, venue and type via management
frames from the Aruba AP. Clients can also query APs for information about the network's
available IP address type (IPv4 or IPv6), roaming partners, and supported authentication
methods, and receive that information in Information Elements from the AP.

post.description: List of Hotspot2 profile 802.11u public access service providers.

get.description: List of Hotspot2 profile 802.11u public access service providers.

patch.description: List of Hotspot2 profile 802.11u public access service providers.

delete.description: List of Hotspot2 profile 802.11u public access service providers.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaHotspot2_Hotspot2Schema.description:
Hotspot 2.0 is a WFA specification based upon the 802.11u protocol that provides wireless clients
with a streamlined mechanism to discover and authenticate to suitable networks, and allows
mobile users the ability to roam between partner networks without additional authentication.
Mobility Conductor supports Hotspot 2.0 with enhanced network discovery and selection. Clients
can receive general information about the network identity, venue and type via management
frames from the Aruba AP. Clients can also query APs for information about the network's
available IP address type (IPv4 or IPv6), roaming partners, and supported authentication
methods, and receive that information in Information Elements from the AP.

hs-profile.description: List of Hotspot2 profile 802.11u public access service providers.

access-network-type.x-typeDescription: The enum define of hotspot Hs_access_nw_type.

anqp-domain-id.description: Number representing the ANQP Domain Id.  Zero means no domain.

comeback-mode.description:
By default, ANQP information is obtained from a GAS(Generic advertisement service) Request and Response.
If you enable the comebackmode option, advertisement information is obtained
using a GAS Request and Response. as well as a Comeback-Request and Comeback-Response.
This option is disabled by default.

homogeneous-essid.x-typeDescription:
The mac-address type represents an IEEE 802 MAC address.
The canonical representation uses lowercase characters.

In the value set and its semantics, this type is equivalent
to the MacAddress textual convention of the SMIv2.
homogeneous-essid.description: This optional parameter devices an AP's homogenous ESS identifier, which is that device's MAC address in colonseparated hexadecimal format.

osen.description: Enable OSU Server-only authenticated layer 2 Encryption Network (OSEN).

pame-bi.description: Pre Association Message Exchange BSSID Independent.

qos-map-excp.description: Qos Map DSCP Exception fields (upto 21 sets).

qos-map-range.description: Qos Map DSCP Ranges (total 8 sets <low>:<high>, <low> cannot be greater than <high>).

radius-cui-disable.description:
Disable RADUIS Chargeable-User Identity (CUI) attribute defined by RFC 4372. Home
networks can use this attribute to identify a user for the
roaming transactions that take place outside of that home network.

radius-loc-data-disable.description:
Disable RADIUS Location Data attribute defined by RFC 5580. Enabling this
parameter allows the RADIUS server to use location data.

profile-type.x-typeDescription: The enum define of hotspot advertisement-profile type.
profile-type.description:
Associates advertisement profile with the hotspot profile.
You can associate any of the following advertisement profiles:
 anqp-3gpp
 anqp-domain-name
 anqp-ip-addr
 anqp-nai-realm
 anqp-nwk-auth
 anqp-roam-cons
 anqp-venue-name
 h2qp-conn-cap
 h2qp-oper-class
 h2qp-osu-provider
 h2qp-oper-name
 h2qp-wan-metrics

items.description: Associates anqp-3gpp profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-domain-name profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-ip-addr-avail profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-nai-realm profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-nwk-auth profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-roam-cons profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates anqp-venue-name profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates h2qp-conn-cap profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates h2qp-oper-class profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates h2qp-oper-name profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates h2qp-osu-provider profile with the hotspot profile.
Associates h2qp-wan-metrics profile with the hotspot profile.

anqp-domain-id.description: Number representing the ANQP Domain Id.  Zero means no domain.

comeback-mode.description:
By default, ANQP information is obtained from a GAS(Generic advertisement service) Request and Response.
If you enable the comebackmode option, advertisement information is obtained
using a GAS Request and Response. as well as a Comeback-Request and Comeback-Response.
This option is disabled by default.

homogeneous-essid.x-typeDescription:
The mac-address type represents an IEEE 802 MAC address.
The canonical representation uses lowercase characters.

In the value set and its semantics, this type is equivalent
to the MacAddress textual convention of the SMIv2.
homogeneous-essid.description: This optional parameter devices an AP's homogenous ESS identifier, which is that device's MAC address in colonseparated hexadecimal format.

osen.description: Enable OSU Server-only authenticated layer 2 Encryption Network (OSEN).

pame-bi.description: Pre Association Message Exchange BSSID Independent.

qos-map-excp.description: Qos Map DSCP Exception fields (upto 21 sets).

qos-map-range.description: Qos Map DSCP Ranges (total 8 sets <low>:<high>, <low> cannot be greater than <high>).

radius-cui-disable.description:
Disable RADUIS Chargeable-User Identity (CUI) attribute defined by RFC 4372. Home
networks can use this attribute to identify a user for the
roaming transactions that take place outside of that home network.

radius-loc-data-disable.description:
Disable RADIUS Location Data attribute defined by RFC 5580. Enabling this
parameter allows the RADIUS server to use location data.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.
